item.title: China Accuses U.S. of Blackmail After Trump Threatens More Tariffs
item.description: China sees little to gain in capitulating to President Trump’s tariff threats, labeling them “blackmail” and vowing to “fight to the end.”

item.title: China Vows to “Fight” Tariffs War With the U.S. “to the End”
item.description: Lin Jian, the spokesman for the Chinese Foreign Ministry, accused the United States of “economic bullying” after President Trump threatened an additio...

item.title: With Trump’s Return, Netanyahu Faces Fewer Restraints On Gaza Than Ever
item.description: On the war, President Trump is more aligned than his predecessor with the aims of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel and his right-wing coali...

item.title: Is Trump Having a Liz Truss Moment?
item.description: Ms. Truss, Britain’s prime minister for 44 days, was forced out after her radical policies caused a market meltdown. But there are some key difference...

item.title: Israel’s Supreme Court Considers Netanyahu’s Attempt to Fire Spy Chief
item.description: The hearing on the move opened with unruly scenes, as hecklers forced judges to pause the proceedings before resuming them without a public audience.
